value: , northeren Niger is currently unsafe for travel due to the long-running conflict with the nomadic Tuareg people. After the Libyan Civil War in 2011 a significant amount of arms have been brought in to the area and the situation could deteriorate quickly. Kidnappings of westerners have also occured. A government permit is required to travel in northern Niger and unlikely to be granted for tourism, persons trying to enter independently without a permit have been arrested and deported out of the region. (Updated March 2013)
